ui

Class Connect4TextConsole

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Connect4Constants
      • ui.Connect4TextConsole

  • public class Connect4TextConsole
extends Connect4Constants
    Radically overhauled version of the Connect4TextConsole class. Now extends the Connect4Constants class for easy access to String variables.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class core.Connect4Constants

        COLUMNS, COMPUTER, CPU_GAME_TEXT, DISPLAY_REQUEST_TEXT, GUI, INVALID_DISPLAY_TEXT, INVALID_MODE_TEXT, INVALID_MOVE_TEXT, MODE_REQUEST_TEXT, ONGOING, OPPONENT_P1_WINS_GUI, OPPONENT_P2_WINS_GUI, P1, P1_INVALID, P1_QUIT, P1_TURN, P1_WINNER, P1_WINS, P1_WINS_GUI, P1_WINS_TEXT, P1_YOUR_TURN_GUI, P1_YOUR_TURN_TEXT, P2, P2_INVALID, P2_QUIT, P2_TURN, P2_WINNER, P2_WINS, P2_WINS_GUI, P2_WINS_TEXT, P2_YOUR_TURN_GUI, P2_YOUR_TURN_TEXT, PLAYER, PVP_GAME_TEXT, ROWS, TEXT_CONSOLE, TIE, TIE_GAME, TIE_GAME_GUI, TIE_GAME_TEXT, WAIT_FOR_P1_TEXT, WAIT_FOR_P2_TEXT, WAITING, WAITING_FOR_P1_GUI, WAITING_FOR_P2_GUI, WINDOW_TITLE_GUI

      • getGameMode

        public char getGameMode(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Gets the user's input selection for whether they will play against an opponent or another player.
        Parameters:
        scan - Scanner instance to read the user's input
        Returns:
        selection of either P (player) or C (computer)

      • getDisplayFormat

        public char getDisplayFormat(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Gets the user's input selection for whether they would like a text console interface or GUI for the display format.
        Parameters:
        scan - Scanner instance to read the user's input
        Returns:
        selection of either T (text console) or G (GUI)

      • getMove

        public int getMove(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Reads an input from the user for which column they would like to play their token in.
        Parameters:
        scan - Scanner instance to read the user's input
        Returns:
        the column selection -- a number between 1 and 7

      • displayStart

        public java.lang.String displayStart(char selection)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks which game mode that the user ahs selected and sends the user a confimration of teh selection.
        Parameters:
        selection - the players selection of game mode
        Returns:
        String message explaining what game is launching
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - user did not select an valid opponent. Notifies the player if they need to make another selection

      • displayBoard

        public java.lang.String displayBoard(char[][] gameBoard)
        A method to convert the gameBoard 2D array into a String for the text console.
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - the 2d array representing the columsn and rows
        Returns:
        the completed String with column borders

      • displayWinner

        public java.lang.String displayWinner(int outcome)
        Notifies the player if the game has ended and specifies who won.
        Parameters:
        outcome - 1,2 or 3 for P1 win, P2 win or a tie game
        Returns:
        String of the winning message (or tie game message)
